reports.label: No Apparent Specification or Consistency Errors in Introductory Text
reports.explanation: The analysis indicates that Section 1 of RFC 9887, which introduces TACACS+ over TLS, is purely descriptive and contains no specification or consistency errors.
justification: The candidate issue explicitly notes that there are no apparent specification or consistency errors in the introductory text (Issue 1).
The analysis describes the section as providing descriptive motivation and high-level positioning without actionable rules or detailed behavior.

summary: (E1) The candidate issue states that the introductory section is purely descriptive and free of specification or consistency errors.

reports.severity_basis: The section is introductory in nature, providing only motivational context without any executable behavior or detailed specifications.
